definition: Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: You can discard loser in the side suit that the dummy is short of.
sentences.chinese: 你可以墊掉明手所缺少的旁套花色中的輸張。

sentences.english: The opening spade 8 is ducked in dummy.
sentences.chinese: 明手放掉了首攻的黑桃8。

sentences.english: You can discard loser in the side suit that the dummy be short of.
sentences.chinese: 你可以墊掉明手所缺少的旁套花色中的輸張。

sentences.english: But on the play of the last heart dummy will have to give up one of these cards.
sentences.chinese: 但是在最後張紅心時，你必須明手放棄一個威脅張。

sentences.english: You can discard losers in the side suits that the dummy is short of.
sentences.chinese: 你可以墊掉明手所缺少的旁套花色中的輸張。

definition: organizer of a gambling party who takes a cut of the winnings/banker (gambling)/preceding player (in a game)/(dialect) boss/proprietor
throwing weapon/dart/goods sent under the protection of an armed escort
to face the enemy/to meet an attack
lots (to be drawn)/lot (in a game of chance)
to feign an opening in order to hoodwink the opponent (in a fight, combat etc)
petty thief (lit. quick fingered and vanish)/empty-handed/having nothing
